title: 'Trump app scam': Over 200 in Karnataka fall prey to investment fraud, lose Rs 2 crore
content: A fraudulent app named 'Trump Hotel Rental,' featuring AI-generated content of the former US President, has reportedly defrauded over 200 investors in Karnataka of nearly Rs 2 crore. The scammers lured victims with promises of high returns on investments, but the earnings displayed on the app were fictitious. Police investigations are underway across multiple districts following numerous complaints.

title: 'No one helped us': Family of 7 suicide in Panchkula leaves neighbourhood in shock
content: In a tragic incident in Panchkula, Praveen Mittal and his family of six were found dead in their car, victims of suspected suicide due to overwhelming financial debts. Praveen, visibly distraught, confessed to their dire situation before collapsing, leaving the community in shock.

title: Kerala has most number of active Covid cases in India
content: Kerala is currently experiencing a surge in Covid-19 cases, reporting the highest number of active cases in the country with 430, a significant jump from 95 earlier in May. While most patients experience mild symptoms like fatigue and cough and recover without hospitalization, two deaths have been recorded this month. The elderly and those with comorbidities remain particularly vulnerable.

title: 'Haven't done anything yet and Pakistan is already sweating': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi issued a stern warning to Pakistan, highlighting India's actions regarding the Indus Water Treaty and its impact. He criticized the neglect of dam maintenance in Jammu and Kashmir under the treaty, asserting India's right to utilize its water resources effectively. Modi emphasized a firm stance against terrorism, advocating a strong response to cross-border attacks.

title: Trump to Apple: Okay, you go to India but you're not going to sell in America without ...
content: President Trump is pushing Apple to manufacture iPhones in the United States, threatening a 25% tariff on imported products if they continue production in India. Trump expressed his desire for Apple to prioritize domestic manufacturing, even though India has offered tariff-free deals.

title: Can Kuldeep Yadav be India's trump card in England?
content: The last time England's "Bazballers" faced Kuldeep Yadav, they found it tough to pick his length, variations, and to some extent, loop as well. He took 19 wickets in four Test matches on a "true wicket," not a rank-turner, and turned the tide towards India after they were trailing 0-1 in the five-match series. Although Kuldeep won't have fond memories of England, where he had a forgettable experience at Lord's in 2018, at 30, with more maturity and improved skillsets, he can be India's trump card.

title: Blast in Amritsar village near Pak border kills suspected Babbar Khalsa member
content: A man died in an explosion near Naushera village in Amritsar, close to the Pakistan border. Police suspect the blast was caused by mishandling an explosive device. The deceased is believed to be a member of Babbar Khalsa, a banned terror group with suspected ties to Pakistan’s ISI, who came to retrieve an explosive consignment.

title: 'We haven't achieved anything': Ponting says PBKS can’t celebrate yet
content: Despite Punjab Kings securing a top-two IPL 2025 playoff spot with a victory over Mumbai Indians, coach Ricky Ponting emphasises that the team's journey is far from over. He acknowledges the team's balance and leadership under Shreyas Iyer, but stresses the importance of maintaining focus and finishing the job in the upcoming Qualifier 1.

title: Anupam Mittal warns of India’s ‘biggest brain drain’, not to Silicon Valley, but to …
content: Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal sparked a debate on social media addiction, expressing concern over Indians' digital consumption habits. He highlighted that excessive scrolling on platforms like TikTok, Instagram, and YouTube is creating an overstimulated and under-inspired generation.

title: India’s first! Tata-Airbus to make 'best-selling' H125 chopper in India
content: Airbus and Tata Advanced Systems will establish an H125 helicopter Final Assembly Line in Kolar, Karnataka, marking India's first private-sector helicopter assembly. The facility aims to produce 10 helicopters annually, expanding based on a projected regional demand of 500 light helicopters over two decades.

title: Virender Sehwag takes a cheeky jibe at Rohit Sharma
content: Virender Sehwag playfully commented on Rohit Sharma's struggles in the IPL powerplay, noting that a slower start might help him stay at the crease longer, given his tendency to get out early. Rohit's recent form includes only three scores above 50 in 13 innings, with nine dismissals during the powerplay.

title: JAC 10th result 2025 declared: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: The JAC Class 10th Result 2025 has been officially declared today, May 27, with a pass percentage of 91.71%, surpassing last year’s performance. Over 4.33 lakh students appeared for the exams held between February and March. Students can check their results via the official JAC websites, DigiLocker, or SMS for quick and easy access.

title: Google DeepMind CEO 'warns' students getting into college: World you entering will ...
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts AGI within a decade, foreseeing workplace disruption alongside the creation of engaging new jobs. He advises students to immerse themselves in AI technologies, emphasizing adaptability and continuous learning. Hassabis highlights AI, VR, AR, and quantum computing as promising fields, urging students to combine passions with core skills to thrive in the evolving AI-driven landscape.

title: Family of 7 found dead in car: Suicide pact suspected, debt angle under probe
content: In a distressing incident, a family of seven from Dehradun was found dead in a car in Panchkula, suspected to be a suicide pact. Preliminary investigations suggest heavy debt drove the family, including Praveen Mittal, his parents, wife, and three children, to take this extreme step.

title: Shreyas Iyer's boundary rope chat with Akash Ambani goes viral
content: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in the IPL 2025 after defeating Mumbai Indians by seven wickets, marking their first playoff appearance in 11 years. Priyansh Arya's composed innings and Josh Inglis' explosive half-century propelled Punjab to victory. A viral moment occurred when Mumbai owner Akash Ambani was seen in conversation with Punjab captain Shreyas Iyer during the match.

title: Atmanirbhar Bharat push: AMCA plan gets green light; all you need to know
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has approved the AMCA Programme Execution Model, aiming to boost indigenous defence capabilities. The Aeronautical Development Agency will collaborate with industry partners to develop the AMCA prototype, a fifth-generation stealth fighter jet. While the first two squadrons will use GE-F414 engines, the next five will feature 110 kilonewton engines, with production expected by 2035.

title: IPL match today, LSG vs RCB: All you need to know
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru aims for a top-two finish for the first time since 2016 as they face Lucknow Super Giants in their final league game. RCB needs a win to secure second place, while LSG, despite inconsistency, remains a dangerous opponent with key players returning. The pitch favors spinners and pace variations, with teams preferring to chase.

title: How big is universe? Discover what scientists have uncovered beyond Pluto
content: The universe's vastness challenges human comprehension. It contains trillions of galaxies and countless stars. Pluto's distance highlights cosmic scales. The observable universe spans 93 billion light-years. Dark energy fuels continuous expansion. Voyager 1 marks a tiny step in space exploration. Our quest for knowledge redefines our place in the cosmos. Mankind is at the threshold of discoveries.

title: 'Heard bumps as he drove over people': Eyewitnesses recount Liverpool horror
content: During Liverpool's Premier League victory parade, a car drove into the crowd, injuring nearly 50 people, with 27 hospitalized. Eyewitnesses described the horrifying scene as the car plowed through fans, leaving people injured on the roadside. The driver, a 53-year-old man, was arrested, and authorities believe he acted alone, not considering it terrorism.

title: ‘Bhool Chuk Maaf’ box office: Film crosses Rs 30 crore mark
content: Rajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf,' a blend of comedy, drama, and time loop elements, has captivated audiences. The film, overcoming release hurdles, earned Rs 7 crore on its opening day and witnessed substantial growth over the weekend, crossing Rs. 30 crore in India after a 4-day run. Despite competition, the movie is maintaining a steady pace at the box office.

title: 'Doing it for fun': Woman's Uber driver turns out to be her office team lead
content: In Bengaluru, a woman's Uber ride took an unexpected turn when she discovered her driver was none other than her team lead from work. He revealed that he drives in his spare time as a recreational activity to alleviate boredom. This unusual incident has sparked amusement and skepticism online, highlighting the unique aspects of Bengaluru's professional culture.

title: Norway Chess: Magnus Carlsen defeats D Gukesh in opening round
content: Magnus Carlsen defeated D Gukesh in the Norway Chess tournament, showcasing his endgame skills. Hikaru Nakamura also secured a win against Fabiano Caruana. Arjun Erigaisi triumphed over Wei Yi in an Armageddon game after a draw. In the women's category, Koneru Humpy defeated R. Vaishali in an all-Indian match.

title: Monsoon intensifies across India; IMD issues multiple warnings
content: Delhi is bracing for rain, thunderstorms, and strong winds, with a yellow alert issued for potential disruptions. Mumbai experiences relief with light rainfall and anticipates continued showers. Coastal Karnataka faces a red alert with forecasts of extremely heavy rainfall, while Kerala is under alert for heavy rains, thunderstorms, and high winds, prompting safety measures and coastal warnings.

title: Blue Islands aircraft makes emergency landing due to 'technical issue'
content: A Blue Islands aircraft, en route from Birmingham to Jersey, executed an emergency landing shortly after takeoff due to a technical issue affecting one of its engines. The crew followed standard procedures, shutting down the engine preventively after a cockpit alert. Passengers recounted a frightening experience, praising the pilot's handling of the situation, while the AAIB decided against further investigation.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 dips below 24,760; BSE Sensex down over 900 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,750, BSE Sensex was trading below 81,400.

title: 'Nakal karne ke liye akal chahiye': Owaisi mocks Pak over fake 'Op Bunyan' pic
content: Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif and army chief Asim Munir for displaying a fake image of a Chinese military drill as their own victory over India. He advised the Indian diaspora in Kuwait to disregard Pakistan's claims entirely, emphasizing their lack of intelligence in even attempting to copy others. This follows the viral circulation of the misleading photo.

title: Sandeep Reddy & Deepika Padukone controversy: How Twitterati reacted
content: Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film 'Spirit,' starring Prabhas, faces controversy after Deepika Padukone's exit and Triptii Dimri's casting. Vanga accused an unnamed actor of violating an NDA and playing "dirty PR games," hinting at Padukone. Reports suggest Padukone's demands and discomfort with the script led to her departure.

title: Gold prices are up over Rs 5,000 from recent lows, but will the rally sustain?
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures at MCX saw a slight increase, trading at Rs 96,050/10 g, while silver futures remained nearly unchanged at Rs 98,045/kg. Despite mixed international results, domestic precious metals concluded positively on Monday.

title: Nepal's Sherpa Kami Rita breaks own record with 31st Everest summit
content: Nepal's Kami Rita Sherpa has once again broken his own record by summiting Mount Everest for the 31st time. The 55-year-old guide led a team, including members of the Indian Army Adventure Wing, to the summit. This latest ascent solidifies his position as the record holder for the most Everest climbs. ​​His closest competitor is fellow Sherpa Pasang Dawa, who has climbed Everest 29 times.

title: Preity Zinta lavishes praise on PBKS' 'captain fantastic' Shreyas Iyer
content: Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, lauded Shreyas Iyer's exceptional leadership as captain, highlighting his synergy with coach Ricky Ponting. She expressed excitement about playing the qualifier in Mullanpur and emphasized the team's unwavering focus on winning for their loyal fans. Zinta acknowledged the uncontrollable aspects of the game but praised the team's dynamic.

title: IPL: How Rohit Sharma's poor form with the bat is hurting MI's campaign
content: Mumbai Indians' IPL 2025 top-two hopes crashed after a loss to Punjab Kings, spotlighting Rohit Sharma's inconsistent form. Despite a few impactful innings, his overall performance has been underwhelming, averaging 27.42 with 329 runs. His struggles have hurt MI's top-order stability, especially during their early-season losses. As MI head into the Eliminator, Rohit's performance is crucial for their title aspirations.

title: 'Hand of Kremlin?': Russian official mocks Macron’s awkward moment with wife
content: Maria Zakharova, Russia's foreign ministry spokeswoman, ridiculed a video of Emmanuel Macron and his wife in Hanoi, suggesting a marital dispute. Macron dismissed the claims as a joke, but the incident sparked a reaction from the Elysee Palace.

title: New Covid variant NB.1.8.1 is a VUM: What does it say about its severity, and more?
content: NB.1.8.1, a new Omicron subvariant, is under scrutiny as a variant under monitoring (VUM) due to its increasing global presence. While it appears more transmissible, severity hasn't increased. Symptoms are similar to other Omicron strains, with a unique report of persistent low-grade hyperthermia. Staying informed, vaccinated, and practicing good hygiene remain crucial for protection.

title: Big worry for MI: Historical hurdle awaits ahead of IPL 2025 Eliminator
content: Mumbai Indians' quest for a top-two IPL finish faltered after a loss to Punjab Kings, placing them fourth. Despite Suryakumar Yadav's stellar run and strong bowling, MI must now navigate the tougher Eliminator route. Historically, MI's titles have come when they finished in the top two, a feat they missed this season.

title: Watch: Terrifying moment when a car barreled through Liverpool parade crowd, nearly 50 injured
content: A 53-year-old man was arrested after driving a minivan into a crowd celebrating Liverpool's Premier League victory in England on Monday, May 26, 2025. The incident injured 47 people, including four children, with some requiring hospitalization. Authorities believe it was an isolated event and are not treating it as terrorism, despite the driver's actions during the parade.

title: Rahul Gandhi, Kharge pay tribute to Jawaharlal Nehru on his death anniversary
content: On Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru's 61st death anniversary, Rahul Gandhi honored his great-grandfather, acknowledging his pivotal role in establishing a robust foundation for independent India. Gandhi highlighted Nehru's visionary leadership and invaluable contributions to social justice, modernity, education, the constitution, and democracy. Mallikarjun Kharge also paid tribute to Nehru.

title: Covid 19 cases surge in India; 2 unique symptoms of new variant JN.1
content: JN.1 is actually a subvariant of the Omicron, evolving from the BA.2.86 variant, also known as Pirola. It was first identified in Luxembourg in 2023 and since has gradually spread to other parts of the world, and now India. JN.1 is said to be more transmissible than previous variants due to specific mutations in its spike protein, which helps it binds to humans easily. However, as of now, there is no data to prove that it causes any serious illness.

title: Mumbai reels under earliest ever arrival of monsoon, wettest May in 100 years
content: Mumbai experienced its earliest monsoon onset ever recorded, breaking a century-old rainfall record for May with 295mm. The city received very heavy rainfall, with Colaba recording 144.3 mm and Santacruz 74.3 mm. The intense showers exposed the city's unpreparedness, leading to waterlogging in new areas, disrupted train and flight services, and incidents of structural damage.

title: 'We treat Yuzvendra Chahal and the team bus driver with the same respect'
content: Punjab Kings' Shashank Singh lauded coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer for fostering a culture of equality and mutual respect within the team. He emphasized that Ponting's coaching has transformed the team's mindset and belief, while Iyer's leadership provides freedom to every member, including support staff.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests buying CAMS and Inox Wind. CAMS, after breaking consolidation, is expected to resume its uptrend with a target of Rs 4199. Inox Wind, having broken out of a bullish flag pattern, is also anticipated to continue its upward movement, targeting Rs 213.

title: Beyond qualification: PBKS batter shares Shreyas Iyer's blueprint
content: Shashank Singh tempered celebrations after Punjab Kings qualified for the playoffs, emphasizing that their ultimate goal, winning the championship on June 3rd, remains. He highlighted Shreyas Iyer's message that finishing in the top two is only half the battle. Despite Marco Jansen's departure, Shashank expressed confidence in the team's depth and multiple match-winners.

title: Explained: Why Punjab Kings will get two chances to reach IPL 2025 final
content: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in IPL 2025 after defeating Mumbai Indians, marking their first such achievement in 11 years. This victory grants them a crucial advantage: two opportunities to reach the final. Under coach Ricky Ponting and captain Shreyas Iyer, PBKS aim to capitalise on this second chance and pursue their inaugural IPL title.

title: Watch: Preity Zinta can't hold back emotions as Iyer seals Qualifier 1 spot
content: Co-owner Preity Zinta's exuberant celebration stole the show as Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in the IPL league stage. Skipper Shreyas Iyer's match-winning six against Mumbai Indians triggered Zinta's passionate outburst. The victory, fueled by Inglis and Arya's impressive partnership, gives Punjab Kings a crucial advantage in the playoffs.

title: ‘Draw your conclusions’: Jaishankar hints at China’s role in Pakistan conflict
content: External affairs minister Jaishankar asserted that India's military actions, not US mediation, compelled Pakistan to agree to a ceasefire. He criticized China's close defense ties with Pakistan and highlighted Pakistan's open support for terrorism. Jaishankar also addressed India's relationship with Russia, European double standards, and the progress of the India-EU Free Trade Agreement, expressing optimism about Indo-German defense cooperation.

title: With sports becoming a profession, youngsters should look for opportunities in the field, says former international cricketer Javagal Srinath
content: While sportspersons in India were only practising on the field, besides lifting weights in the gym, their counterparts in other countries were undergoing advanced and in-depth training programmes, he said

title: Owaisi mocks Pakistan’s Munir for ‘gifting fake photo’ to PM Sharif
content: Asaduddin Owaisi is part of the multi-party delegation visiting Kuwait to brief nations on India’s response to the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Karnataka rains: Early and more intense monsoon disrupts life in coastal and south interior parts of Stata
content: Four rain-related deaths were reported in various part of Karnataka between from Sunday night till Monday evening

title: What is the Bharat Forecast System: world’s highest resolution forecasting model
content: India’s new high-resolution BFS model delivers 6-km precision forecasts at the panchayat level, surpassing US, UK, and EU systems in accuracy. What is BFS?

title: Bodies of five youths drowned in river Godavari in Konaseema  retrieved
content: The eight youths, including two minors, reportedly ventured into the  river as they were not familiar with its location and depth; Rescue operation by the NDRF is still in progress.

title: AUT wants unified admission panel for self-financing and aided streams in colleges in T.N.
content: Association of University Teachers calls for fee regulations, CAS payment, and administrative reforms in aided colleges

title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh approves AMCA execution model through industry partnership
content: The first prototype of AMCA is expected to roll out by 2028-29 and production is expected to begin from 2032-33 with induction targeted in 2034, as per officials

title: In Iran, Pakistan PM expresses willingness to hold peace talks with India to ‘resolve all issues’
content: "We want to resolve all disputes, including the Kashmir issue and the water issue, through negotiations and are also ready to talk to our neighbour on trade and counter-terrorism,” he said.

title: PM Modi holds roadshow in Gandhinagar
content: People gathered in large numbers, waving the tricolour along the route of PM Modi’s roadshow in Gandhinagar.

title: IMD issues red alert for three Kerala districts as low-pressure system strengthens monsoon winds
content: Red alert for three districts – Kannur, Wayanad and Kozhikode – and orange alert for remaining districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam and Alappuzha where yellow alert has been sounded

title: Odisha to patent terminologies associated with Puri Jagannath temple
content: The move to patent temple-related terms has generated considerable public interest due to controversy around use of ‘Dham’ for West Bengal government-built temple at Digha

title: From bear rescue centres to education of disadvantaged children, here are four volunteering opportunities around Bengaluru
content: If you find time hanging on your hands, try something new and adventurous by signing up as a volunteer. PS: It will look good on your CV as well

title: Actor Unni Mukundan booked for allegedly assaulting manager
content: Alleged assault occurred over Unni Mukundan’s manager’s positive review of a recent Malayalam film in which the lead character is played by another actor, according to FIR

title: 2026 Assembly polls will be a Gogoi versus Saikia contest, says Assam BJP chief
content: The regional Assam Jatiya Parishad hopes the Jorhat MP’s elevation as State Congress president will give the United Opposition Forum renewed momentum

title: Karnataka rains: Heavy downpour hits Hassan district, landslips on Shiradi Ghat
content: Leader of Opposition in Legislative Assembly R. Ashok will be visiting rain-hit areas of Hassan district

title: Karnataka lawyer duped by cyber fraudsters using AI-generated Donald Trump video
content: The issue came to light on May 6, when the advocate approached the Haveri Central Crime Police Station with a complaint

title: Containers from capsized Liberian ship wash ashore on Thiruvananthapuram coast in Kerala
content: Local administration deploys police personnel to ensure that nobody tampers with the containers which may contain hazardous chemicals or inflammable material

title: Top Maoist commander Tulsi Bhuinya killed in police encounter in Jharkhand
content: Nitesh Yadav, who has a bounty of ₹15 lakh, along with other Maoists also reported to have been shot; top officials of Jharkhand Jaguar including Palamu SP are camping in the area

title: Nehru believed in democracy not demagoguery: Congress pays tributes to India's first PM
content: “On his death anniversary, we honour the nation’s first Prime Minister, Pt. Jawaharlal Nehru, whose vision shaped modern India. His ideals of democracy, secularism and scientific temper continue to guide our way forward,” Congress said

title: CPI leaders protest in Tirupati for revival of Visakhapatnam Steel Plant
content: CPI state secretariat member P Harinath Reddy demands the governments to allocate more funds for further development of the public-sector unit

title: Discoms told to ensure consumer satisfaction with quality power supply in A.P.
content: Grievances filed by consumers should be treated with utmost urgency and any delay, negligence and complacency of officials will be viewed as dereliction of duty, says Chief Secretary

title: Kakani Govardhan Reddy sent to 14-day judicial remand in illegal mining case
content: While the YSRCP leaders claim that it is a fake case, the TDP claims that the former minister deserves punishment

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. renames YSR district as ‘YSR Kadapa’
content: The G.O. Ms. No. 170 order has been issued in this regard by G. Jayalakshmi, Special Chief Secretary, Revenue Department

title: Study finds stingless bees increase crop yield, quality
content: A team of entomologists from Nagaland University recorded 11 major insect species foraging on chilli blooms

title: M.P. turning into ‘rape capital’: Congress asks PM Modi to get State a ‘full time’ Home Minister before May 31 visit
content: Addressing a press conference in New Delhi, Vikrant Bhuria, Adivasi Congress president, termed the incident as “Adivasi Nirbhaya case”, linking it with the infamous Nirbhaya case in 2012 in the national capital

title: India beat Uruguay 3-2 in Four Nations Junior Women's Hockey
content: Apart from Kanika (46’, 50’), Sonam (21’) was on target for India, while Milagros Seigal (3’) and Agustina Mari (24’) scored for Uruguay in the match in Rosario on Sunday (May 25, 2025)

title: Delhi CM hails V.K. Saxena on completing three years as LG
content: Rekha Gupta said that the day marked another "significant chapter in the administrative and developmental history" of the capital.

title: Congress poses questions about ceasefire conditions at Jai Hind rally in Barmer
content: The party leaders present at the event asked if Pakistan agreed to hand over Pahalgam terrorists, while Randeep Singh Surjewala slammed PM’s silence on U.S. President Donald Trump’s trade compromise remarks.

title: 10th international convention of SPIC MACAY inaugurated at IIT Hyderabad
content: The week-long exploration of India’s classical and spiritual traditions saw over 1,500 students and volunteers from across India and abroad

title: CISF sub-inspector scales Mt. Everest
content: Geeta Samota scaled the peak on May 19. She has climbed five of the world’s highest peaks and now has only North America and Antarctica left to complete the prestigious Seven Summits challenge

title: Tribal Affairs Minister highlights achievements in 11 years of NDA government
content: Complaints about alleged irregularities on clearances for the Great Nicobar project were ‘under examination’, Jual Oram said

title: Rajya Sabha election: DMK, AIADMK to begin shortlisting their candidates from Tamil Nadu soon
content: Given the strength of the two parties and their allies in the Assembly, four seats can be bagged by the DMK and the balance by the AIADMK

title: India embraces tourism, Pakistan sees 'terrorism as tourism', says Modi
content: “Terrorism is a way of making money for your (Pakistan) government and Army. The people of Pakistan must come forward to end terrorism. Live a happy and peaceful life and have your meal. Otherwise, my bullet is there for you (sukh chain ki zindagi jio, roti khao. Varna meri goli to hai hee),” the Prime Minister asserted in the direct message to those across the border

title: Students irked over Pondicherry varsity’s new code of conduct
content: The code of conduct, which seeks to enforce discipline on the campus, uses broad terms such as “decorous manner” of behaviour and provides for imposing a penalty of up to ₹6,000 for “any act of moral turpitude”

title: India pushing back ‘illegal’ immigrants to Bangladesh
content: The migrants included women and children who were detained by the Delhi Police from outer Delhi last week during a drive to identify illegal immigrants

title: Maoist leader cremated in Narayanpur amidst family’s demand to return him to his village in Andhra Pradesh
content: The police said that there had been ‘no legal claimant’ for the seven bodies, including that of top Maoist leader Basavaraju

title: Mumbai breaks record, receives highest rainfall in May
content: Colaba Coastal Observatory recorded the highest rainfall this May at 300 mm, breaking the record from 1918 of 279.4 mm

title: Kerala govt. to crack down on teachers, staff involved in POCSO cases: Minister
content: 77 POCSO cases reported so far against those working in secondary schools. 3 POCSO cases reported in vocational higher secondary division

title: Bar district administration, civic volunteers from Bengal poll process: BJP
content: Suvendu Adhikari said that fair elections are a prerequisite to democracy in West Bengal and urged the Chief Electoral Officer to change the Standard Operating Procedure

title: Bareilly police begin 15-day drive to identify Rohingya and Bangladeshi migrants
content: The move follows ‘insturctions from the administration,’ as the police have been ordered to focus on temporary shanties, and detain suspects as per MHA guidelines

title: Maldives extends ‘firm support’ to India in fight against terrorism
content: Maldives Foreign Minister Abdulla Khaleel appreciated the recent emergency financial assistance from India; he held a bilateral meeting with External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar

title: Rain wreaks havoc in Kozhikode
content: Around 60 houses damaged in different parts of the district; three relief camps opened; 88 people shifted to camps

title: Court accepts closure report to cancel sexual harassment case against Brij Bhushan
content: The police had recommended the cancellation of the complaint involving the minor wrestler, saying “no corroborative evidence” was found

title: Desecration of Ajit Jogi’s statue days before inauguration sparks row
content: The late leader’s son, MLA Amit Jogi, and supporters stage protest, demand reinstallation of statue in the same spot

title: University of Liverpool to open campus in Bengaluru; admission from next year
content: The inaugural cohort of undergraduate and postgraduate students will join the university in August 2026, initially offering programmes in business management, accounting and finance, computer science, and biomedical sciences

title: Nitish Kumar courts controversy for placing flower pot IAS officer’s head
content: People present at the occasion were surprised to see the Bihar CM treating a senior IAS officer in such a manner

title: Bharat Forecast System set to give sharper rain alerts
content: Bharat Forecast System has shown ‘notable improvements’ since 2002, said the Ministry of Earth Sciences; the latest version can provide short to medium term forecasts that are given over a span of three to seven days

title: Aishwarya Rai, ex-wife of Tej Pratap, terms Lalu’s action against his son a ‘drama’
content: Ms. Rai alleged when Lalu’s family members were aware that Tej Pratap was in relation with another woman then why did they get her marry and ruin her life

title: Centre’s reform nudge to States resulting in less land wastage, increased digitisation
content: According to data shared by the Finance Ministry, 22 states have carried out reforms in building bye laws for industrial and commercial plots. Of these, 18 States have reduced land wastage in factory plots due to outdated setbacks and parking regulations to less than 30%

title: From Pahalgam and Gulmarg, Omar Abdullah to make bid to woo tourists to Kashmir
content: The Chief Minister will chair a tourism stakeholders meeting, show the return of normalcy to prospective tourists

title: Culture meets compassion at Miss World 2025 ‘Beauty with a Purpose’ gala in Hyderabad
content: Miss World contestants share stories of grassroot social impact; top five humanitarian initiatives acknowledged by royal dignitaries, drawing attention to the transformative work across the globe

title: RTI reveals ₹12.97 lakh foreign trip by panel for Bengaluru metro fare hike, but exposes gap in transparency on report
content: The fare hike, which came into effect on February 9, was the first revision in over seven years, and has since made Namma Metro the most expensive metro transit system in India among major cities.

title: Governor travels 7 km by helicopter as protests continue in Manipur
content: The protesters had formed a human chain on the road to the airport, where he landed from New Delhi after attending the Rising Northeast Investors Summit

title: The Hindu wins in content, marketing and green initiatives at Abby Awards 2025
content: The Group’s city campaign ‘Made of Chennai’ won silver award for ‘Best Marketing of a Printed Newspaper/Edition’ under the Publisher Abby category. The campaign successfully deepened local engagement, celebrating the spirit, stories, and people of Chennai through print and on-ground activities

title: Crack on under-construction overbridge along NH 66 at Manathala in Thrissur sparks outrage
content: Serious safety concerns arise from a 50m crack on an under-construction overbridge, triggering public outrage and official investigations.

title: Kaleshwaram soaks in spiritual fervour as the 12-day Saraswati Pushkaralu draws to a close
content: An estimated 30 lakh pilgrims took a holy dip at Triveni Sangamam  in Kaleshwaram during the mega religious fete from May 15 to 26, officials said

title: TPCC to have a jumbo executive committee with over 100 office bearers; Revanth and Mahesh to meet high command on Cabinet expansion on May 30
content: Much-anticipated State Cabinet expansion has been pushed by at least a week as deliberations on the induction of more Ministers could not be held on Monday as AICC chief Mallikarjun Kharge was not present in New Delhi

title: 11 COVID-19 cases in West Bengal; health workers say no need to panic but urge caution
content: While overall national caseload remains low, medical experts warned against complacency in urban areas like Kolkata, and urged adherence to hygiene protocols and full vaccination.

title: Street vendors knock on GHMC’s door against harassment
content: Pushcart vendors say Operation ROPE (Removal of Obstructive Parking & Encroachments) by the Traffic Police has majorly impacted their livelihood

title: Optimistic about achieving 10-12% credit growth for FY26: Indian Bank MD Binod Kumar
content: ‘The two interest rate cuts by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and also expectations of further cuts is likely to spur credit demand’

title: Three electrocuted in Srikakulam
content: A few families had brought decorative lights from Berahampur and installed them without taking proper safety precautions; the drizzle and gales caused the wires to snap, leading to the accident

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Thunder take win over Wolves in a tough Game 4
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western Conference finals.

title: Jalen Williams' breakout playoff effort fuels OKC
content: Oklahoma City's Jalen Williams had the best offensive performance of his postseason career Monday night against the Timberwolves, scoring 34 points to put the Thunder one win away from the NBA Finals.

title: 'That's wonderful': Canes finally see ECF skid end
content: The Hurricanes staved off elimination and snapped a 15-game Eastern Conference finals skid with a 3-0 victory over the Panthers in Game 4.

title: Ant defends Game 4 approach after quiet night
content: After one of his quietest offensive nights this postseason, Timberwolves star Anthony Edwards defended his approach in Monday's Game 4 loss to the Thunder that put Minnesota on the brink of playoff elimination.

title: Police say Liverpool parade collision not terrorism
content: The Merseyside Police have said that the incident of a car colliding with pedestrians in Liverpool city center during Liverpool Football Club's Premier League victory parade is not being treated as terrorism.

title: Dodgers' Ohtani hits 2nd leadoff homer in 2 days
content: Los Angeles Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani, the reigning NL MVP, hit a leadoff homer in consecutive games for the second time in his career, going deep against Cleveland's Gavin Williams for his 19th long ball of the season in his club's 7-2 win Monday.

title: Sources: Raiders' Cole now NFL's top-paid punter
content: The Raiders and All-Pro punter AJ Cole have agreed to a four-year, $15.8 million contract extension with $11 million guaranteed, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Ronaldo hints at Al Nassr exit: 'Chapter is over'
content: Cristiano Ronaldo hinted at a potential departure from Al Nassr after scoring in the Saudi Pro League's season finale Monday, declaring his "chapter is over" in a social media post.

title: DeGrom fails to record a strikeout in career first
content: Rangers starter Jacob deGrom, playing in his 229th game Monday against the Blue Jays, failed to record a strikeout for the first time in his major league career.

title: 🏈 Ranking college football coaches as players
content: There are small-school studs and a Heisman winner. There's a national title QB and one of the best ever.

title: Memorial Day MLB standings check: Playoff field predictions, biggest surprises and more
content: Our experts look at the best and worst of the season to date -- and predict which teams will rule from here on out.

title: NBA free agent rankings: Kevin Pelton's top 25 for 2025
content: Will LeBron James opt in or sign a new deal? Can Indy keep Myles Turner? We're breaking down what's next for 25 star free agents.

title: The decline of a dynasty: The Patriots had a 'difficult' two seasons. Can Mike Vrabel reignite them?﻿
content: The Patriots have revamped their front office, coaching personnel and roster after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in hopes of closing the gap in the AFC East.

title: Which Fever players will see their production rise with Caitlin Clark out?
content: Here's how Caitlin Clark's injury affects fantasy women's basketball players and futures odds in the WNBA.

title: Caitlin Clark injury reaction: What's next for Indiana Fever star
content: The Fever announced Clark will miss at least two weeks with a quad strain. What's next for Clark and her team?

title: How Xabi Alonso made his rapid rise from rookie coach to Real Madrid
content: Less than three years into his career as a top-level coach, Alonso is returning to Real Madrid, the most pressurized job in football. He's earned it.

title: Two iconic races, one day: McLaren's quest to win Monaco, Indy 500
content: On Sunday, McLaren tried to win two races 4,500 miles apart: F1's Monaco GP and IndyCar's Indianapolis 500.

title: Maiden Indy 500 win completes Palou's domination of IndyCar
content: After three titles and 15 wins, Álex Palou felt incomplete. Now an Indy 500 winner, that's no longer the case.

title: Premier League 2024-25 awards: From best game to worst signing
content: Bill Connelly takes a look at the numbers and gives out his awards to the best and worst performers of the 2024-25 Premier League season.

title: Sources: Man Utd wait on Delap after deal agreed
content: Man United have agreed the framework of a deal for Liam Delap, sources have told ESPN, and are now waiting for him to decide on his next move.

title: Sources: Yamal nears new Barça deal until 2031
content: Lamine Yamal is close to extending his Barcelona contract until 2031 after a positive meeting between club president Joan Laporta and the player's agent, Jorge Mendes, on Monday, sources told ESPN.

title: Barcelona sneak into Pot 1 for UCL draw again
content: Barcelona will be in Pot 1 of seeds for the league phase draw of the 2025-26 UEFA Champions League (UCL), and for the second successive season it's because Roma missed out on the final day.

title: Neymar out of Ancelotti's first Brazil squad
content: Carlo Ancelotti has left Neymar out from his first squad selection and has brought back Casemiro, Richarlison and Antony for the upcoming World Cup qualifiers.

title: Veterans Lozano, Ochoa return to Mexico squad
content: Winger Hirving Lozano and goalkeeper Guillermo Ochoa will return to the Mexican national team for a pair of friendly matches against Switzerland and Turkey before the Gold Cup.

title: Inzaghi denies Inter exit talks ahead of UCL final
content: Inter Milan coach Simone Inzaghi has addressed speculation regarding his future, aiming to prevent it from becoming a disruptive element as his team prepares for the Champions League final.

title: It's Good Guy vs. Bad Guy on Season 33 of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: UFC Hall of Famers Daniel Cormier and Chael Sonnen break down what to expect from this season of TUF.

title: Waiver wire: Three hitters to add power to your infield
content: Todd Zola outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and lineup tips for your fantasy roster.

title: Emerging Valkyries pickups to stream
content: Veronica Burton and Kayla Thornton highlight some of the top fantasy women's basketball streamers for the week of May 26.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego Wave starting to look formidable
content: San Diego are undefeated in six games and don't seem to be slowing down anytime soon. That and more in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool's Gakpo on Bayern shortlist
content: Bayern Munich have added Liverpool forward Cody Gakpo to their shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Heart Attack Or Panic Attack? Why Young Men Calling Ambulances For Anxiety
content: Latest research shows young men are turning to ambulance services when their anxiety symptoms become overwhelming - some even think they're having a heart attack.

title: Terrorist Killed In Blast While Trying To Retrive Explosive In Amritsar: Police
content: A terrorist with suspected links to the Babbar Khalsa terror group died while removing an explosive in Amritsar's Majitha, police said this morning.

title: Rs 20 Crore Debt Reportedly Behind Suicide Pact Of Family Of 7
content: A family of seven, including three children, allegedly consumed poison and died by suicide owing to financial distress.

title: Himanta Biswa Sarma Vows To End Child Marriage In Assam By 2026
content: The Assam government's approach of taking legal action against child marriage led to an 81 per cent decline in such cases in 20 of its 35 districts between 2021-22 and 2023-24, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

title: From Student-Teacher Love Story To Face-Shoving Video: Macrons In Spotlight
content: They first met at the Catholic Lycee La Providence, where Brigitte, then 39, was a high school teacher and Emmanuel, 15, was her student.

title: "Child Came With Good Wishes": Mamata Banerjee Visits Tejashwi Yadav
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee visited a private hospital in Kolkata this morning to congratulate RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on becoming a father.

title: "Everything On Camera This Time": PM Takes A 'Proof' Swipe At Opposition
content: Taking a swipe at the Opposition, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said armed forces recorded Operation Sindoor airstrikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir on camera, just in case anyone at home asked for "proof".

title: Iran Ready To Compromise With US On Nuclear Program But On This Condition
content: Iran on Monday indicated it is open to compromises on its nuclear program in talks with the United States, after US President Donald Trump described weekend talks with Tehran as "very good".

title: Turkey is Bringing 5,000 Year Old Bread Recipie To Life, Here's How
content: Archaeologists have unearthed more than 5000 years old bread that was buried beneath the threshold of a newly built house in what is today central Turkey, and helped a local bakery to recreate the recipe -- with customers lining up to buy it.

title: New Zealand Minister Slammed For "Never Respond To Indians' Emails" Remarks
content: New Zealand Immigration Minister Erica Stanford is under fire for saying she "never responds" to emails from Indians, because she considers them "akin to spam."

title: Border Force Proposes To Name One Of Its Post "Sindoor" After Operation's Success
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) has proposed to name a post in the Samba sector as "Sindoor" and two other in the name of the personnel killed during the cross-border shelling by Pakistan on May 10.

title: "Knowing More Languages Enhances Employability": Education Minister To NDTV
content: Countering the Opposition's offensive against the three-language formula in the National Education Policy (NEP), Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan has blamed "political positioning" by three states and stressed that NEP does not impose Hindi.

title: Dharmendra Pradhan's "Crocodile Tears" Jibe At Rahul Gandhi At NDTV Conclave
content: Reiterating his party's charge that the Congress indulges in feudal politics, Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan launched a scathing jibe at Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of shedding "crocodile tears" on issues of social justice.

title: Delhi Court Denies Bail To EX-AAP MLA Naresh Balyan In Extortion Case
content: A Delhi court on Tuesday dismissed the bail application of former AAP MLA Naresh Balyan in a case lodged under the stringent MCOCA Act.

title: Mumbai Gets 106 mm Rain In Last 24 Hours, Heavy Showers Predicted
content: After being pummelled by heavy downpours at the start of the week, Mumbai witnessed a brief respite on Tuesday morning, with the island city recording an average rainfall of 106 mm in 24 hours, civic officials said.

title: Hong Kong Invites Foreign Students As Trump Bans Them From Harvard
content: Hong Kong, a Chinese territory, has opened its doors to "top talent" at Harvard amid the American university's ongoing conflict with US President Donald Trump.

title: King Charles To Give Historic Speech To Canada Parliament Amid US Tensions
content: King Charles III is to deliver a historic speech to open Canada's parliament on Tuesday, with the nation, of which he is head of state, facing unprecedented threats from US President Donald Trump.

title: Delhi Court Denies Bail To AAP MLA Naresh Balyan In Extortion Case
content: A Delhi court on Wednesday denied bail to AAP MLA Naresh Balyan in a case under the stringent Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA).

title: Two-stop experiment doesn't fix F1's Monaco procession problem
content: formula 1's two-stop experiment at the Monaco Grand Prix underlines what the sport already knew about its most famous race . the confines of the circuit are too tight to allow genuine racing . it succeeded in providing a more dynamic race than the previous year, but with just one legal overtake in 78 laps, the fundamental issue with Monaco as an F1 venue was clear to see .
